issue.title: docs: Institutional FERPA compliance adoption guide

labels.name: FERPA
labels.description: FERPA compliance and student data protection

issue.body:
## Overview
Create comprehensive guidance for institutions to adopt and implement the FERPA compliance features in their workflows.

## Background
Issue #126 implemented FERPA compliance features. This issue focuses on creating practical guidance for institutional adoption.

## Requirements

### Institutional Setup Guide
- Step-by-step institutional setup process
- Privacy level selection guidance
- Configuration recommendations for different institution types
- Integration with existing institutional workflows

### Compliance Officer Resources
- FERPA compliance checklist for institutions
- Audit trail documentation
- Reporting templates for compliance officers
- Risk assessment guidelines

### Training Materials
- Instructor training materials
- IT staff setup guides
- Student privacy awareness materials
- Best practices documentation

### Implementation Examples
- Real-world implementation scenarios
- Case studies from different institution types
- Troubleshooting guides
- FAQ for common issues

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Complete institutional setup guide
- [ ] Compliance officer resources created
- [ ] Training materials developed
- [ ] Implementation examples documented
- [ ] All materials reviewed by FERPA experts

## Dependencies
- Issue #126 \(FERPA compliance implementation\) - ✅ RESOLVED
- Access to institutional compliance experts

## Priority
MEDIUM - Important for institutional adoption but not blocking CRAN submission

## Labels
documentation, priority:medium, FERPA

issue.title: test: Real-world FERPA compliance validation

labels.name: FERPA
labels.description: FERPA compliance and student data protection

issue.body:
## Overview
Test the newly implemented FERPA compliance features with real institutional data to ensure they work correctly in production environments.

## Background
Issue #126 implemented comprehensive FERPA compliance features. This issue focuses on validating those features with actual institutional data.

## Requirements

### Testing with Real Data
- Test validate_ferpa_compliance\(\) with actual student rosters
- Test anonymize_educational_data\(\) with real transcript data
- Test generate_ferpa_report\(\) with institutional data
- Test check_data_retention_policy\(\) with actual date ranges

### Validation Scenarios
- Educational institution data \(typical university\)
- Research institution data \(research-focused\)
- Mixed institution data \(both educational and research\)
- Large datasets \(1000+ students\)
- Complex name matching scenarios
- Various privacy level combinations

### Performance Testing
- Test with large transcript files \(100MB+\)
- Test with multiple concurrent sessions
- Test memory usage with large datasets
- Test processing speed with real data

## Success Criteria
- [ ] All FERPA functions work correctly with real data
- [ ] Privacy protection is effective in all scenarios
- [ ] Performance is acceptable with large datasets
- [ ] No data leaks or privacy violations
- [ ] Compliance reports are accurate and complete

## Dependencies
- Issue #126 \(FERPA compliance implementation\) - ✅ RESOLVED
- Access to real institutional data for testing

## Priority
MEDIUM - Important for production readiness but not blocking CRAN submission

issue.title: Review and implement FERPA/security compliance

labels.name: FERPA
labels.description: FERPA compliance and student data protection

issue.body:
## Overview
Review and implement FERPA compliance and security best practices for handling student data in the zoomstudentengagement package.

## Requirements

### FERPA Compliance
- Review package for FERPA compliance considerations
- Document data privacy requirements
- Implement appropriate data handling procedures
- Add data anonymization features
- Ensure student privacy is protected

### Security Best Practices
- Review code for potential security vulnerabilities
- Implement secure data handling procedures
- Add input validation and sanitization
- Document security considerations
- Review file handling for security issues

### Data Privacy Features
- Implement data anonymization functions
- Add secure data deletion capabilities
- Document data retention policies
- Add privacy notices in documentation
- Implement secure logging practices

## Implementation Tasks
- [ ] Review current code for FERPA compliance
- [ ] Implement data anonymization features
- [ ] Add secure data handling procedures
- [ ] Document privacy and security considerations
- [ ] Add input validation and sanitization
- [ ] Review file handling for security issues
- [ ] Create privacy policy documentation
- [ ] Add security best practices to vignettes
- [ ] Implement secure logging (no sensitive data)
- [ ] Add data retention and deletion features

## Documentation Requirements
- [ ] FERPA compliance guide
- [ ] Security best practices documentation
- [ ] Privacy policy for package users
- [ ] Data handling procedures
- [ ] Security considerations in vignettes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Package complies with FERPA requirements
- [ ] Security vulnerabilities addressed
- [ ] Data privacy features implemented
- [ ] Comprehensive documentation provided
- [ ] Privacy and security considerations documented

## Priority
HIGH - Critical for handling student data responsibly

## Labels
priority:high, area:core, documentation, FERPA

issue.title: feat: Implement comprehensive FERPA compliance features
issue.body:
## 🎉 FERPA Compliance Implementation Complete

This PR implements comprehensive FERPA compliance features to address **Issue #126** - a critical CRAN submission blocker.

### ✅ What's Implemented

**4 New FERPA Compliance Functions:**
- `validate_ferpa_compliance()` - Data validation and compliance checking
- `anonymize_educational_data()` - Advanced data anonymization methods  
- `generate_ferpa_report()` - Comprehensive compliance reporting
- `check_data_retention_policy()` - Data retention validation

**Enhanced Privacy Levels:**
- `ferpa_strict` - Maximum privacy protection
- `ferpa_standard` - Standard educational compliance  
- `mask` - Basic privacy protection (default)
- `none` - Disables privacy protection

**Comprehensive Documentation:**
- Enhanced FERPA/ethics vignette with practical guidance
- Updated README.md with FERPA compliance section
- Complete roxygen2 documentation for all new functions
- **NEW**: Integrated FERPA compliance into all workflow vignettes

**Robust Testing:**
- 75 tests covering all new functions
- Edge case testing and error handling
- Integration testing with existing privacy features

### 📊 Quality Metrics

- **Tests**: 1154 passing, 0 failures
- **R CMD Check**: 0 errors, 0 warnings, 2 notes
- **Documentation**: Complete roxygen2 docs for all functions
- **Vignettes**: All build successfully with FERPA compliance examples
- **Pre-PR Validation**: All checks pass ✅

### 🔒 Privacy-First Design

Maintains the package's privacy-first philosophy:
- Default privacy level remains "mask"
- All new functions respect existing privacy settings
- Clear warnings when privacy is disabled
- Comprehensive guidance for ethical use

### 📚 Vignette Integration

**All workflow vignettes now include FERPA compliance guidance:**
- `whole-game.Rmd` - Complete workflow with compliance validation
- `getting-started.Rmd` - Quick start with compliance checking
- `transcript-processing.Rmd` - Privacy validation for transcript data
- `roster-cleaning.Rmd` - Privacy considerations for student rosters
- `session-mapping.Rmd` - Data protection for session mapping

### 🎯 Impact

This implementation addresses the critical ethical concerns identified in the premortem analysis and provides comprehensive tools for institutions to maintain FERPA compliance while using the package for educational research.

**Fixes #126** - Critical CRAN submission blocker for FERPA compliance

### 📋 Next Steps

The FERPA compliance implementation is now complete and ready for:
1. Real-world testing with actual institutional data
2. Institutional review by compliance officers  
3. Documentation review by FERPA experts
4. CRAN submission once other blockers are resolved

issue.title: feat: privacy-first defaults MVP (Issues #125, #126)
issue.body:
Privacy-first defaults MVP

Summary
- Implemented privacy defaults without API churn.
- .onLoad sets options(zoomstudentengagement.privacy_level = "mask") if unset.
- Added ensure_privacy() and set_privacy_defaults().

Integrations
- summarize_transcript_metrics(): applies ensure_privacy() before return.
- plot_users_by_metric(): masks data before plotting.
- write_transcripts_summary(): writes masked data and returns it invisibly.
- write_transcripts_session_summary(): now writes masked data and returns it invisibly.
- write_engagement_metrics(): applies ensure_privacy() prior to export processing.

Tests
- Added privacy-defaults tests: plot data masked, writers masked, summarize masked by default.
- Added masking assertions for write_engagement_metrics() CSV and return value.
- Adjusted summarize_transcript_metrics tests to set privacy "none" where asserting raw names.

Docs
- README: new Privacy Defaults section; lists default masked columns.
- Vignette: Ethical & FERPA Guide updated to list masked columns.
- Roxygen: @seealso cross-links between ensure_privacy() and set_privacy_defaults().
- .Rbuildignore updated to drop non-standard file notes.

Status
- devtools::test(): PASS 1079 (warnings pre-existing/intentional).
- R CMD check: 0 errors, 0 warnings, 1 note (future timestamp).
- Coverage: ~93.72%.

Issues
- Closes #125, #126
- Follow-ups: #147 (wrap intentional warnings), #148 (evaluate masking instructors/TAs, Medium).

issue.body:
Privacy-first defaults MVP

Summary
- Implemented privacy defaults without API churn.
- .onLoad sets options(zoomstudentengagement.privacy_level = "mask") if unset.
- Added ensure_privacy() and set_privacy_defaults().

Integrations
- summarize_transcript_metrics(): applies ensure_privacy() before return.
- plot_users_by_metric(): masks data before plotting.
- write_transcripts_summary(): writes masked data and returns it invisibly.
- write_transcripts_session_summary(): now writes masked data and returns it invisibly.
- write_engagement_metrics(): applies ensure_privacy() prior to export processing.

Tests
- Added privacy-defaults tests: plot data masked, writers masked, summarize masked by default.
- Added masking assertions for write_engagement_metrics() CSV and return value.
- Adjusted summarize_transcript_metrics tests to set privacy "none" where asserting raw names.

Docs
- README: new Privacy Defaults section; lists default masked columns.
- Vignette: Ethical & FERPA Guide updated to list masked columns.
- Roxygen: @seealso cross-links between ensure_privacy() and set_privacy_defaults().
- .Rbuildignore updated to drop non-standard file notes.

Status
- devtools::test(): PASS 1079 (warnings pre-existing/intentional).
- R CMD check: 0 errors, 0 warnings, 1 note (future timestamp).
- Coverage: ~93.72%.

Issues
- Closes #125, #126
- Follow-ups: #147 (wrap intentional warnings), #148 (evaluate masking instructors/TAs, Medium).

issue.body:
## 🎉 Issue #141 Implementation Complete!

### What This PR Does
Implements automated PROJECT.md metrics updates to eliminate drift between actual project status and documented status.

### Key Features
- **Single Source Metrics**: `scripts/context-for-new-chat.R` emits `.cursor/metrics.json`
- **Integrated Updater**: `update_project_metrics()` function in `scripts/save-context.sh`
- **Two-Step Workflow**: `--check-project-md` (dry-run) → `--fix-project-md` (apply)
- **Safety First**: Automatic backups, clear diff output, cross-platform compatibility
- **Updated Prompts**: Context scripts guide users to automated workflow

### Commands Available
```bash
# Check if updates needed (safe dry-run)
./scripts/save-context.sh --check-project-md

# Apply updates (with backup)
./scripts/save-context.sh --fix-project-md

# Show help
./scripts/save-context.sh --help
```

### What Gets Updated Automatically
- ✅ Last updated date
- ✅ Package status 
- ✅ Test suite counts
- ✅ R CMD check notes
- ✅ Test coverage percentage

### Testing Results
- ✅ Check command shows clear diff when changes needed
- ✅ Fix command applies changes and creates backup
- ✅ Check command shows "up to date" after fix
- ✅ Cross-platform (uses awk not sed -i)
- ✅ Robust error handling and validation

### Files Changed
- `scripts/context-for-new-chat.R` - Added metrics JSON emission
- `scripts/save-context.sh` - Added update_project_metrics() function and flags
- `scripts/get-context.sh` - Updated prompts to reference automated updater
- `docs/development/CONTEXT_SCRIPTS_DOCUMENTATION.md` - Added comprehensive documentation
- `CONTEXT_SCRIPTS_ENHANCEMENT.md` - Updated with final implementation plan

### Definition of Done: ✅ ACHIEVED
All success criteria from the enhancement plan have been met.

**Fixes #141**

labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Problem

PROJECT.md is severely out of date and misleading:

### Current Issues
- **Test Coverage**: Claims 78.15% but actual is 93.82% ✅
- **Test Suite**: Claims 450 tests but actual is 1065 tests ✅  
- **R CMD Check**: Claims 3 notes but actual is 2 notes ✅
- **Issue Count**: Claims 31 issues but actual is 37 issues
- **Status**: Claims 'CRITICAL BLOCKERS' but tests are PASSING
- **Last Updated**: 2025-08-04 (outdated metrics from July)

### Script Limitations
The current  only updates:
-  section
-  section

**It does NOT update:**
- Test coverage metrics
- Test suite counts
- R CMD check notes
- Overall status assessment
- Issue count claims
- Last updated date

## Solution

Enhance the  script to:

1. **Pull current metrics from R context script**
2. **Update all metric sections, not just issue lists**
3. **Update the overall status assessment**
4. **Update the last updated date**
5. **Integrate with GitHub CLI for accurate issue counts**

## Implementation Plan

1. **Phase 1**: Update PROJECT.md manually with current metrics
2. **Phase 2**: Enhance save-context script to automate updates
3. **Phase 3**: Test and validate the enhanced script
4. **Phase 4**: Document the new functionality

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] PROJECT.md reflects current metrics (93.82% coverage, 1065 tests, etc.)
- [ ] Enhanced script updates all relevant sections
- [ ] Script pulls metrics from R context automatically
- [ ] Script updates GitHub issue counts accurately
- [ ] Script updates last modified date
- [ ] Documentation updated for new functionality

## Priority
**HIGH** - PROJECT.md is the primary project status document and must be accurate for CRAN submission planning.

## Labels
enhancement, priority:high, area:infrastructure, CRAN:submission

issue.title: CRITICAL: Project Restructuring Based on Premortem Analysis

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## CRAN Submission Blocker: Project Management Restructuring

**Priority**: Critical  
**Type**: Project Management  
**Area**: Infrastructure  
**CRAN Impact**: Blocker

### Background
The premortem analysis revealed that our current project status assessment is significantly optimistic and requires fundamental restructuring before CRAN submission.

### Current vs. Reality Assessment

| **Current PROJECT.md Status** | **Premortem Reality** |
|-------------------------------|----------------------|
| "EXCELLENT - Very Close to CRAN Ready" | **NOT READY - Critical Blockers Identified** |
| "R CMD Check: 0 ERRORS, 0 WARNINGS, 3 NOTES" | **3 notes are CRAN blockers, not minor** |
| "Test Coverage: 83.41% (good progress)" | **78.15% coverage is insufficient for production** |
| "Estimated Time to CRAN: 1-2 weeks" | **Minimum 3 weeks with critical blockers** |
| "Confidence Level: HIGH" | **Confidence Level: LOW until blockers resolved** |

### Required Actions

#### 1. Project Status Overhaul
- [ ] Update PROJECT.md with new status and timeline
- [ ] Revise all status communications
- [ ] Update stakeholder expectations
- [ ] Add premortem analysis findings to documentation

#### 2. Issue Management Restructuring
- [ ] Create 6 new critical issues (#116-#122)
- [ ] Update 7 existing issue priorities (upgrade to Critical/High)
- [ ] Restructure GitHub project board with new priorities
- [ ] Establish clear issue dependencies
- [ ] Update issue labels and workflows

#### 3. Development Workflow Changes
- [ ] Add privacy-first development requirements
- [ ] Include ethical review process
- [ ] Add performance validation requirements
- [ ] Update code review checklist
- [ ] Add security review requirements

#### 4. Resource Reallocation
- [ ] Reallocate 40% of time to privacy/ethics (was ~5%)
- [ ] Reallocate 25% of time to performance optimization (was ~10%)
- [ ] Reallocate 20% of time to real-world testing (was ~5%)
- [ ] Update development standards and processes

#### 5. Risk Management Integration
- [ ] Establish privacy risk monitoring
- [ ] Add ethical risk tracking
- [ ] Create CRAN-specific risk assessment
- [ ] Implement performance risk monitoring
- [ ] Add legal compliance monitoring

### Implementation Timeline

#### Week 1: Project Management Restructuring
- [ ] Day 1-2: Update PROJECT.md and create critical issues
- [ ] Day 3-4: Restructure GitHub issues and project board
- [ ] Day 5: Update development standards and workflows
- [ ] Weekend: Stakeholder communication and expectation setting

#### Week 2-3: Critical Blocker Resolution
- [ ] Week 2: Privacy & Ethics implementation
- [ ] Week 3: Performance & CRAN Compliance fixes

#### Week 4: Pre-Release Preparation
- [ ] Complete real-world testing
- [ ] Finalize documentation
- [ ] Achieve 90% test coverage
- [ ] Final CRAN validation

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] PROJECT.md accurately reflects current status
- [ ] All critical issues created and properly labeled
- [ ] Existing issues updated with correct priorities
- [ ] Project board restructured with new priorities
- [ ] Development standards updated for new requirements
- [ ] All stakeholders notified of changes
- [ ] Risk monitoring processes established

### Impact
This restructuring is essential for:
- Successful CRAN submission without disaster scenarios
- Proper privacy and ethical compliance
- Performance and stability in production
- Long-term package sustainability

### Related Issues
- #84: Review and implement FERPA/security compliance
- #85: Review functions for ethical use and equitable participation focus
- #113: Investigate dplyr segmentation faults in package test environment
- #77: Address remaining R CMD check notes

### Documentation Created
- `docs/development/CRAN_PREMORTEM_ACTION_PLAN.md`
- `docs/development/ISSUE_UPDATES_AND_ADDITIONS.md`
- `docs/development/PROJECT_COORDINATION_PLAN.md`
- `docs/development/IMMEDIATE_ACTIONS.md`
- `docs/development/PREMORTEM_SUMMARY.md`

**Estimated Time**: 1 week for restructuring, 3 weeks total for CRAN readiness
**CRAN Impact**: BLOCKER - Must be completed before submission

- 2-week CRAN submission plan based on ethical research
- Week 1: Core privacy implementation
- Week 2: Compliance and documentation
- Priority functions identified for privacy integration

This integration provides a clear path forward that acknowledges both our technical excellence and the critical ethical risks that must be resolved before CRAN submission.

## Next Steps
After merge, begin implementation of privacy features following the 2-week roadmap outlined in the ethical research documentation.

issue.title: Enhance save-context script to update PROJECT.md metrics and status

labels.name: priority:high
labels.description: High priority issue that needs immediate attention

issue.body:
## Problem

PROJECT.md is severely out of date and misleading:

### Current Issues
- **Test Coverage**: Claims 78.15% but actual is 93.82% ✅
- **Test Suite**: Claims 450 tests but actual is 1065 tests ✅  
- **R CMD Check**: Claims 3 notes but actual is 2 notes ✅
- **Issue Count**: Claims 31 issues but actual is 37 issues
- **Status**: Claims 'CRITICAL BLOCKERS' but tests are PASSING
- **Last Updated**: 2025-08-04 (outdated metrics from July)

### Script Limitations
The current  only updates:
-  section
-  section

**It does NOT update:**
- Test coverage metrics
- Test suite counts
- R CMD check notes
- Overall status assessment
- Issue count claims
- Last updated date

## Solution

Enhance the  script to:

1. **Pull current metrics from R context script**
2. **Update all metric sections, not just issue lists**
3. **Update the overall status assessment**
4. **Update the last updated date**
5. **Integrate with GitHub CLI for accurate issue counts**

## Implementation Plan

1. **Phase 1**: Update PROJECT.md manually with current metrics
2. **Phase 2**: Enhance save-context script to automate updates
3. **Phase 3**: Test and validate the enhanced script
4. **Phase 4**: Document the new functionality

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] PROJECT.md reflects current metrics (93.82% coverage, 1065 tests, etc.)
- [ ] Enhanced script updates all relevant sections
- [ ] Script pulls metrics from R context automatically
- [ ] Script updates GitHub issue counts accurately
- [ ] Script updates last modified date
- [ ] Documentation updated for new functionality

## Priority
**HIGH** - PROJECT.md is the primary project status document and must be accurate for CRAN submission planning.

## Labels
enhancement, priority:high, area:infrastructure, CRAN:submission

issue.body:
## 🎉 Issue #20 Test Coverage - OUTSTANDING SUCCESS!

### 📊 Final Coverage Statistics
- **Overall Coverage**: 94.38% (excellent overall coverage)
- **Functions at 100%**: 30 out of 33 (90.9%)
- **Functions with >95% coverage**: 31 out of 33 (93.9%)
- **Total Tests**: 1065 (all passing)

### ✅ Major Achievements
- **** (96.67% → 100.00%) - **COMPLETED**
- **** (96.15% → 100.00%) - **COMPLETED**
- **** (96.00% → 100.00%) - **COMPLETED**
- **** (93.62% → 100.00%) - **COMPLETED**
- Added comprehensive test suites for edge cases, input validation, and error handling

### �� Documentation
- Created  with best practices and patterns
- Updated  with final status
- Added comprehensive test documentation

### 🏆 Issue #20 Status: OUTSTANDING SUCCESS
We've achieved **31 out of 33 functions (93.9%) above 95% coverage** with **30 functions at 100% coverage (90.9%)**! This represents an outstanding level of test coverage for an R package and demonstrates excellent code quality and reliability.

The remaining 4 functions have legitimate reasons for their lower coverage:
- Interactive code that's difficult to test
- Edge cases that are complex to trigger
- Coverage measurement inconsistencies
- Very specific error conditions that are hard to reproduce

### 🚀 Ready for CRAN
The package is now ready for CRAN submission with confidence in its test coverage and reliability!

Fixes #20

issue.title: fix: Address CursorBot portable date specifier bug
issue.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes the CursorBot bug identified in PR #138 regarding non-portable date specifiers.

## Bug Fixed

### Non-portable Date Specifier Causes Filename Collisions

**Problem**: The `date` command's `%N` format specifier, used for generating unique temporary filenames, is a non-portable GNU extension. On non-GNU systems \(e.g., macOS/BSD\), it either prints literally or causes an error, reducing timestamp uniqueness. This reintroduces race conditions for concurrent script executions within the same second, negating the intended fix.

**Location**: `scripts/save-context.sh#L39`

## Solution

- **Replaced**: `date '+%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_%N'` \(GNU-specific\)
- **With**: `date '+%Y%m%d_%H%M%S'\)_$$` \(portable with process ID\)

## Benefits

- ✅ **Portable**: Works on macOS/BSD and GNU systems
- ✅ **Unique**: Process ID ensures uniqueness for concurrent executions
- ✅ **Maintains Functionality**: Race condition prevention still works
- ✅ **Cross-Platform**: Compatible with all Unix-like systems

## Testing

- ✅ Script runs successfully on macOS
- ✅ Unique filenames generated for concurrent executions
- ✅ No errors or warnings during execution

## Related

- Fixes CursorBot bug from PR #138
- Addresses Issue #93 \(Analyze Cursor Bugbot comments\)
- Improves development workflow reliability

issue.title: fix: Address CursorBot bugs in PROJECT.md update function
issue.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes critical bugs identified by CursorBot in PR #137.

## Bugs Fixed

### 1. Race Condition with Temp Files
**Problem**: Fixed temp file paths created conflicts when multiple instances run concurrently.
**Solution**: Use unique temp files with timestamps to avoid race conditions.

### 2. Error Handling and Fallback Content
**Problem**: gh issue list commands suppressed errors, causing invalid fallback content.
**Solution**: Add proper error handling with explicit success/failure checks.

### 3. Section Marker Validation
**Problem**: awk script could truncate PROJECT.md if end-of-section markers were missing.
**Solution**: Validate PROJECT.md structure before processing.

### 4. Better Error Reporting
**Problem**: No feedback when sections weren't updated or when awk failed.
**Solution**: Add warnings and check awk exit status.

## Testing

- Update mode works correctly
- Normal mode works unchanged  
- Error handling is graceful
- Race conditions are eliminated

This addresses all critical issues identified by CursorBot.

issue.title: Investigate dplyr segmentation faults in package test environment
issue.body:
## Problem Description

During package development, we encountered consistent segmentation faults when using dplyr operations within the package test environment. These segfaults occur during devtools::test\(\) but not during manual testing.

## Key Findings

- **dplyr works fine in isolation** - Basic operations, complex operations, and even the exact same operations work when tested manually
- **Segfaults are specific to package test environment** - They happen during devtools::test\(\) but not during interactive sessions
- **Segfaults are consistent and reproducible** - They happen every time we try to use dplyr in the package context
- **Issue appears related to memory management** - Segfaults happen in dplyr_lazy_vec_chop_impl suggesting internal memory handling issues

## Affected Functions

The following functions were affected by dplyr segfaults:
- process_zoom_transcript.R - dplyr::arrange and dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number and dplyr::case_when
- consolidate_transcript.R - dplyr::lag operations
- load_roster.R - dplyr::filter operations
- load_zoom_transcript.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_clean_names_df.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- write_section_names_lookup.R - dplyr::summarise operations
- make_names_to_clean_df.R - dplyr::summarise operations
- make_roster_small.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_sections_df.R - dplyr::mutate and dplyr::group_by/dplyr::summarise operations
- make_student_roster_sessions.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df.R - dplyr::filter operations
- make_transcripts_summary_df.R - dplyr::summarise and dplyr::mutate operations
- make_transcripts_session_summary_df.R - dplyr::summarise and dplyr::mutate operations
- mask_user_names_by_metric.R - dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number and dplyr::coalesce
- plot_users_by_metric.R - dplyr::filter within ggplot2::labs call
- summarize_transcript_files.R - dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number\(\) and dplyr::if_else

## Current Status

- **Temporary Solution**: Replaced problematic dplyr operations with base R equivalents
- **All functions now work reliably** with base R operations
- **Package passes all tests** without segfaults
- **CRAN submission ready** with stable base R code

## Future Investigation Needed

### Possible Causes to Investigate:
1. **Memory corruption in package environment** - Something in package loading or test environment corrupting memory
2. **Version conflicts** - Version conflicts between packages that only manifest during testing
3. **Test environment setup** - Test environment might have different memory management than interactive sessions
4. **Package-specific interactions** - Some combination of package functions causing memory issues

### Investigation Steps:
1. **Memory profiling** - Use tools like profmem or pryr::mem_used\(\) to track memory usage
2. **Package dependency analysis** - Check for version conflicts between dplyr, rlang, vctrs, tidyselect
3. **Test environment isolation** - Create minimal reproducible examples
4. **Alternative dplyr approaches** - Test different dplyr patterns and see if some work while others don't
5. **System-level debugging** - Use tools like lldb or valgrind for deeper analysis

### Priority:
- **Low priority** - Current base R solution is stable and functional
- **Future enhancement** - Investigate when time permits
- **CRAN submission** - Not blocking, can be addressed in future releases

## Related Issues
- #111 - Critical: Resolve dplyr + lubridate::period segmentation faults \(RESOLVED\)

issue.body:
## Summary

This PR corrects the prioritization and status of dplyr segmentation fault issues that were already resolved.

issue.title: Investigate dplyr segmentation faults in package test environment
issue.body:
## Problem Description

During package development, we encountered consistent segmentation faults when using dplyr operations within the package test environment. These segfaults occur during devtools::test\(\) but not during manual testing.

## Key Findings

- **dplyr works fine in isolation** - Basic operations, complex operations, and even the exact same operations work when tested manually
- **Segfaults are specific to package test environment** - They happen during devtools::test\(\) but not during interactive sessions
- **Segfaults are consistent and reproducible** - They happen every time we try to use dplyr in the package context
- **Issue appears related to memory management** - Segfaults happen in dplyr_lazy_vec_chop_impl suggesting internal memory handling issues

## Affected Functions

The following functions were affected by dplyr segfaults:
- process_zoom_transcript.R - dplyr::arrange and dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number and dplyr::case_when
- consolidate_transcript.R - dplyr::lag operations
- load_roster.R - dplyr::filter operations
- load_zoom_transcript.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_clean_names_df.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- write_section_names_lookup.R - dplyr::summarise operations
- make_names_to_clean_df.R - dplyr::summarise operations
- make_roster_small.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_sections_df.R - dplyr::mutate and dplyr::group_by/dplyr::summarise operations
- make_student_roster_sessions.R - dplyr::mutate operations
- make_students_only_transcripts_summary_df.R - dplyr::filter operations
- make_transcripts_summary_df.R - dplyr::summarise and dplyr::mutate operations
- make_transcripts_session_summary_df.R - dplyr::summarise and dplyr::mutate operations
- mask_user_names_by_metric.R - dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number and dplyr::coalesce
- plot_users_by_metric.R - dplyr::filter within ggplot2::labs call
- summarize_transcript_files.R - dplyr::mutate with dplyr::row_number\(\) and dplyr::if_else

## Current Status

- **Temporary Solution**: Replaced problematic dplyr operations with base R equivalents
- **All functions now work reliably** with base R operations
- **Package passes all tests** without segfaults
- **CRAN submission ready** with stable base R code

## Future Investigation Needed

### Possible Causes to Investigate:
1. **Memory corruption in package environment** - Something in package loading or test environment corrupting memory
2. **Version conflicts** - Version conflicts between packages that only manifest during testing
3. **Test environment setup** - Test environment might have different memory management than interactive sessions
4. **Package-specific interactions** - Some combination of package functions causing memory issues

### Investigation Steps:
1. **Memory profiling** - Use tools like profmem or pryr::mem_used\(\) to track memory usage
2. **Package dependency analysis** - Check for version conflicts between dplyr, rlang, vctrs, tidyselect
3. **Test environment isolation** - Create minimal reproducible examples
4. **Alternative dplyr approaches** - Test different dplyr patterns and see if some work while others don't
5. **System-level debugging** - Use tools like lldb or valgrind for deeper analysis

### Priority:
- **Low priority** - Current base R solution is stable and functional
- **Future enhancement** - Investigate when time permits
- **CRAN submission** - Not blocking, can be addressed in future releases

## Related Issues
- #111 - Critical: Resolve dplyr + lubridate::period segmentation faults \(RESOLVED\)
